As we continue growing at a fast pace, will you “Dare to Grow” with us?

Senior Business Systems Analyst

YOUR ROLE

The Senior Professional will use his/her skills in leading supply chain application process design, development, testing and deployment, to focus on architecting solutions using Business Process Re-engineering techniques and methods to achieve a defined business outcome. The Senior Professional works on the complete life cycle from business needs definition, through process design, build or system configuration, testing, training, end user and technical documentation and delivery for process enactment and solution delivery. The Senior Professional plays a significant role in re-engineering global Supply Chain processes and solutions for the CEVA Contract Logistics [CL] division which are integrated with other process areas, scalable, flexible, customer focused and follow industry best practices.

WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO?

Independently analyze business problems and operational data from one or more sources to formulate solutions of moderate to significant complexity.

Resolve technical issues and analyze or develops solutions for application programs outside primary application knowledge.

Create Functional Design, Testing and Post Implementation Support for Complex, Medium and Small Projects.

Work closely with IT to ensure changes are properly deployed

Work individually and collaboratively to develop and deliver automation solutions to internal and external stakeholders

Work with external companies and internal resources to define process and strategy including automation

Solution integrator and strong hands-on expertise with leading ERP applications and/or various CEVA systems internal ERP, WMS, LMS and Inventory management systems.

Strong expertise with WMS and its subsystems, MHS, RF device technology, 1D/2D barcode generation and our ERP systems

Serve as a supply chain process expert / SME/ consultant focused on reducing costs and increasing efficiencies within the CL division

Serve as business escalation point of contact for critical/high priority IS system latency / outages impacting associate productivity and company revenue.

Assist and mentor teammates to provide technical leadership and best practices sharing in priority review meetings

Energetic individual with enthusiasm to learn new tools, technologies, and processes

Good communication skills, analytical mind and problem-solving aptitude, ability to assimilate information, updated technical know-how, and ability to think ahead

Process Analysis, Testing, and Communication

Work with business and customers to help them understand their needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.

Must recognize areas for process improvement and develop plans and requirements for implementing them.

Coordinate a collaborative testing process between the business and IT team members.

Proactively identify and report on business issues, dependencies, and risks related to system enhancements, functionality/design gaps, and user acceptance testing.

Support project manager(s) and related job families on company initiatives as a SME and contributing resource.

Must detect and resolve issues effectively across process and systems in a timely manner and escalate accordingly.

Must make sure all measures comply with CEVA’s business/partners standards, governance, policies, and procedures.

Work alongside managers or clients to agree on the IT requirements

Passion for quality, exceptional attention to detail

Business Systems Documentation and Training

Update all relevant documentation such as test scripts, training materials, business process documentation, macros, etc.

Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.

Provide recommendations and advice on emerging technology trends.

Perform regular audits against documentation to ensure the business is complying with governance standards and other policies and procedures.

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Engineering (Industrial/Mechanical) or IS/IT management field or equivalent work experience required.

Minimum of 5-7 years’ experience

Experience in Supply Chain Concepts like Warehouse management, Materials management, Inventory management, process design and Process Improvements. Line management in an operating environment a plus. Excellent communications skills both written and oral.

Experience with any one or more industry leading Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), and Labor Management System (LMS) like SAP, Oracle and/or various CEVA systems internal ERP, WMS, LMS and Inventory management systems.

Experience with material handling systems (MHS) and other industry leading warehouse automation technologies

Good analytical skill, communication skill, proactive, capability of thinking through a scenario

Demonstrated competency in developing efficient and effective solutions to diverse and Complex business problems.

Experience with either 2 or more databases like RDBMS, IMS DB, MS Access, Oracle

Proficient and advanced knowledge with Microsoft Office Suite including but not limited to MS Word, MS Power point, MS Excel, MS Access, MS Visio, MS Project etc.

Create and lead a supportive team-oriented work climate that enables business team members to develop professionally and that values diversity, promotes teamwork and collaboration and emphasizes quality, customer satisfaction, creativity, and cost effectiveness.

WHAT DO WE OFFER?

Medical, Dental, Vision Available Upon Start Date

Employer Matched 401(k)

Paid Time Off (PTO) + Sick Days

Tuition Reimbursement & Career Development

A Company Culture Rich in our Vision and Values with an Open-Door Policy

Company Observed Holidays

Discount Programs that include Wellness, Technology, Retail, and more!

We value your professional and personal growth. That’s why we share plenty of career opportunities for you to thrive within CEVA. This role can be the first step on your career path with us. You can stay in the same job family, find a new family to grow in (an almost limitless number of options) or find your own path. Join CEVA for a challenging and rewarding career.
